intro: Chaerophyllum cicutariiforme, commonly known as the common cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features a basal rosette of finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in meadows. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies.
